page.title: 09Sunday Worship, Cockermouth
page.content: If you require hymns and a sermon in your worship then the Church for you would be the Methodist, Lorton Street. This Church, built in 1932, is highlighted by the organ and choir pews with a central pulpit at the front.There is a young minister and an above average number of young families attend. If you wish complete freedom in your worship then the Cockermouth Christian Fellowship Centre, All Saints' Church Rooms is the place each Sunday afternoon for songs of praise, prayer and guidance on what God wants us to do in the world to-day. Everyone celebrates. If you wish silent worship then the Religious Society of Friends, Kirkgate is the place where members and friends meditate, pray or read aloud for an hour in their 1884 Meeting House.
